DOC.brief_summary: Overactive bladder ( OAB ) common problem impairs quality life 17 % adult population USA age 40 . The issue become prominent get old . OAB determine International Continence Society urgency ( immediate desire urinate could postpone ) without incontinence usually associate increased frequency nocturia ( urination night ) . In 2012 , American Urologic Association publish clinical guideline treatment OAB non neurogenic origin . Neuromodulation propose third line treatment two treatment recommend : sacral nerve neuromodulation ( SNM ) posterior tibial nerve stimulation ( PTNS ) . Each mention procedure invasive . SNM involve lead implantation operate room use X-ray guidance anesthesia . PTNS involve needle insertion low extremity . The investigator would like examine efficacy transcutaneous nerve stimulation ( TENS ) refractory first two line OAB treatment patient .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Transcutaneous Nerve Stimulation Improvement Overactive Bladder Symptoms
